articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden for the first time publicly vowed to withhold weapons from Israel if its forces make a major invasion of Rafah in southern Gaza while negotiations in Cairo on a ceasefire plan for the enclave were due to continue on Thursday.
articles.title: US warns Israel that Rafah invasion will jeopardise weapons supply as assault continues

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden spent months urging Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to protect Gaza civilians, but the U.S. decision to pause some military aid to Israel was linked directly to a pointed phone call they had a month ago, a U.S. official said.
articles.title: Behind Biden's Israel weapons pause: a defiant Netanyahu, a tense phone call

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Billions of dollars worth of U.S. weaponry remains in the pipeline for Israel, despite the delay of one shipment of bombs and a review of others by President Joe Biden's administration, concerned their use in an assault could wreak more devastation on Palestinian civilians.
articles.title: Israel due to get billions of dollars more in US weapons despite Biden pause

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's announcement that he would withhold arms supplies if Israel went through with its assault of Rafah drew a defiant reaction on Wednesday alongside unease at the possible longer term fallout from the open clash with Israel's most vital ally.
articles.title: US warning on arms supplies prompts Israeli defiance, doubts

articles.author: Jack Queen, Luc Cohen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Porn star Stormy Daniels will face tough questioning from Donald Trump's lawyers on Thursday as they try to dismantle the credibility of a woman whose story of a 2006 sexual encounter ultimately led to the first criminal trial of a former U.S. president.
articles.title: Stormy Daniels to face tough questions from Trump lawyers at trial

articles.author: Deisy Buitrago
articles.description: Venezuela is open to paying its $10 billion debt to China, lawmaker Nicolas Maduro Guerra, son of President Nicolas Maduro, told Reuters in an interview on Thursday.
articles.title: Maduro's lawmaker son says Venezuela open to paying $10 billion debt to China

articles.author: Amanda Perobelli, Leonardo Benansatto
articles.description: The death toll from severe flooding in southern Brazil has risen to 107, civil defense said on Thursday, as rescue operations continued and authorities began to see the cost of recovering from the devastation in the state of Rio Grande do Sul.
articles.title: Deaths in Brazil floods rise to 107, horse rescued from rooftop

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: A U.S. congressional committee on China has asked leading research university Georgia Institute of Technology to detail its collaboration with a Chinese university facing U.S. government restrictions due to its alleged ties to the country's military.
articles.title: US committee targets Georgia Tech's alleged ties to Chinese military linked research

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A man shot and wounded two police officers in Paris after he got hold of one of the officer's weapons while he was being held at a police station, said Paris police chief Laurent Nunez on Friday, confirming earlier media reports.
articles.title: Two Paris police officers wounded after man shot them inside police station

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Polish judge with access to military secrets, who asked for asylum in Belarus, looked set to face espionage charges on Thursday, after a Polish court said it was lifting his immunity.
articles.title: Polish judge at heart of spy scandal loses immunity
